availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1859-1861

body.p:
WILLIAM DENNISON,
GOVERNOR OF THE STATE OF OHIO.
To his Excellency, the Governor of the State of Kentucky.

It appears by the annexed papers, duly authenticated according to the Laws of our State, that one Mordecai P. Hunnicut, late of Morgan County. O. stands charged by Indictment with the crime of Forgery and it has been represented that said Hunnicut fled from the Justice of this State, and had taken refuge within the State of Kentucky

Now, Therefore, Pursuant to the provisions of the Constitution and Laws of the United States, in such case made and provided, I do hereby require that the said Mordecai P. Hunnicut be apprehended and delivered to J. S. Hawkins who is hereby duly authorized to receive him and convey him to the State of Ohio, there bo be dealt with according to
In Witness Whereof, I have hereunto affixed my name, and the Great Seal of the State of Ohio, at Columbus, this 24th day of May -- in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty one

BY THE GOVERNOR:
W. Dennison.
A. P. Russell, Secretary of State.
To his Excellency William Denison Gov of Ohio

The undersigned prosecuting attorney of Morgan County Ohio represents that Mordecai P. Hunicut late a resident of Morgan County Ohio has been duely indicted in said county for forgery as will fully appear from a certified copy of said indictment herewith enclosed
In the opinion of the undersigned if the matters and things set forth in said indictment are true the trial of said Mordecai P Hunnicut for said crime would result in his conviction

The undersigned further represents that said Mordecai P Hunnicut has fled from the state of Ohio to avoid ar^r^est and that he has been since arrested in the state of Kentucky and is now confined in jail at Louisville in said state of Kentucky to await the requistion of Your Excellency upon the Governor of Kentucky for his delivery to a proper person to be brought to this county for trial
You are therefore desired to cause proper requisition to made on the Gov of Kentucky for the person of said Mordecai P Hunnicutt
J S Hawkins of Mound City Illinois is named as a proper person to receive said Mordecai P Hunnicut and from the authorites of Kentucky and to bring him to this county for Trial

Robert D Hopper
Prosecuting Attorney of Morgan County Ohio

Applications for Requisition
M. P. Hunnicutt

"The State of Ohio
against } Indictment of Forgery
Mordecai P. Hunnicut

Be it remembered that heretofore to wit: on the 19th day of March in the year of our Lord one thousand Eight and Sixty one, the Grand Jurors of the state of Ohio, at a Court of Common Pleas, held at the Court House, in the Town of McConnelsville, in the Count of Morgan, in said State, being in the Eighth Judicial District of said Court, and at the March Term thereof before the Honorable Lucius P. Marsh Judge, the Grand Jurors of the state of Ohio, to wit: Jacob M. Smith, Jacob Bingman, Joseph Kelly, Jacob Adams, James W. Turner, George Steffy, Hiram Shepard, Smith Townsend, William Sterret, Joseph Noyes, Ezekiel Devol, Phillip Brrooks, John Henderson, Sebastian E. Fouts, and Jordan Betts, of whom the said Joseph Kelly, was by the Court appointed Foreman and the Grand Jurors aforesaid being duly empanneled and sworn and affirmed, and by the Court duly charged according to law on the 21st day of March in the year aforesaid, appeared in open Court and Presented a true Bill of Indictment against the said Mordecai P. Hunnicut, of which the following is a true copy to wit:

The State of Ohio,
Morgan County SS } Court of Common Pleas of the Term of March in the year of Our Lord, One thousand Eight hundred and Sixty one.

The Grand Jurors of the State of Ohio, empannelled, and sworn and affirmed to inquire of crimes and offences
committed within and for the body of the County of Morgan aforesaid, on the oath and affirmation, present and find, that Mordecai P. Hunnicut, on the second day of January, in the year of our Lord, One thousand Eight Hundred and Fifty one, at the County of Morgan, aforesaid; did feloniously, unlawfully and falsely utter publish, and put off to Robert A. Pinkerton, and Henry Linkin ^with intent then and ^there^ to defraud the said Robert A. Pinkerton and Henry Linkin^ a certain false forged and counterfeited promissory notes as a true and genuine promissory note as a note as a true and genuine promissory Note of Ira Patterson given for the payment of forty two dollars which said promissory note then and there was of the tenor and effect of the following to wit:
Chesterfield June 6th 1850
Twelve Months after date I promise to pay to Wm P. Hunnicut or order forty two dollars for value recd.
Ira Patterson
Which said note was indorsed Wm P. Hunnictut
I assign this note to R. A. Pinkerton & Henry Linkin as collateral security Jan 2d 1851.
M. P. Hunnicut

The said Mordecai P. Hunnicut then and there well knowing the aforesaid forged promissory note to be false forged and counterfeited contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the state of Ohio.

And the Grand Jurors of the State of Ohio, aforesaid empanneled sworn and affirmed as aforesaid on their said oath and affirmation aforesaid do further present and find that Mordecai P. Hunnicut on the second day of January in the year of Our Lord one thousand eight hundred and
Fifty one at the County of Morgan aforesaid did feloniously unlawfully and falsely make forge and counterfeit a certain promissory note and the endorsements thereon with the intent to prejudice damage and defraud Robert A. Pinkerton and Henry Linkin which said promissory note is in the words and figures following to wit:
Chesterfield June 6th 1850
Twelve months after date I promise to pay ^to^ Wm P. Hunnicut or order forty two dollars for value recd
Ira Patterson

and which said endorsements are in the words and figures following to wit: Wm P. Hunnicut I assign this note to R. A. Pinkerton & Henry Linkin as collateral security Jan 2d 1851 M. P. Hunnicut contrary to the form of the statute on such case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the State of Ohio

Robert D Hopper
Prosecuting Attorney..
Upon which said Bill of Indictment is the following endorsement to wit

"A true Bill
Joseph Kelly Foreman of the Grand Jury..
"Filed March 21/ 1861."

The State of Ohio
Morgan County SS } I George S. Welsh Clerk of the Court of Common Pleas, within and for the County of Morgan, and state aforsaid hereby certify, that the foregoing are true copies of the Journal entry, and the Indictment found against the said Mordecai P. Hunnicut, at the March Term of said Court, in the year first aforesaid.

figure.ab: COMMON PLEAS OF THE COUNTY OF MORGAN.

body.p: Given under my and and the seal of said Court of Common Pleas, at McConnelsville in said Court this 18th day of May A.D. 1861

Geo. S. Welsh Clerk of said Court
By Wm Robinson Deputy

Ohio
Warrant Issd
Nov 14. '61
M. P. Hunnicut
Forgery

Copy of Indictment
M. P. Hunnicut
